Model A's response one:
Well, hell, when I first laid eyes on you boys... it was like lookin' at a flock of chickens pecking at the ground, scared of their own shadows. I saw a bunch of fellas who'd forgotten how to live, how to laugh. Looked at the whole setup and thought to myself, "Hell, compared to where I just come from, this is a country club." Model A's response two:
Hard? Let me tell you, it was like tryin' to herd cats in a vacuum. At first, you were all wound so tight you'd squeak if you walked. Yessir, that's why I came to this establishment for, to bring you birds fun and entertainment 'round the gamin' table. It just took a little proddin' to remind you all you weren't made of glass.

Model B's response one:
Heh, let me tell ya. When I first walked onto that ward and saw all you fellas... pecker-checkers, every last one of ya... I saw a bunch of ghosts. You were all walkin' around so timid, scared of that big bad nurse. I figured, hell, this ain't a nuthouse, it's a rabbit hutch, and you're all the rabbits. But I also saw potential. A deck of cards just waitin' to be shuffled and dealt a winning hand. This place needed a jolt of life, and I was just the man to provide the electricity.

Model B's response two:
Was it hard? Ha! Son, it was like pullin' teeth from a rooster. You boys were so used to sittin' quiet, doin' what you were told. I'd try to start a card game, and you'd all look at me like I was speakin' some foreign language. But you just gotta be persistent, you know? Like water on a rock. You keep splashin', keep laughin', keep pushin' the rules, and sooner or later, that rock starts to wear down. Before you know it, we're bettin' cigarettes and hollerin' over a fishing trip. You just had to remember what it felt like to be men again.
